reviews.title: Lovely countryside "get away from it all" treat
reviews.text: Just returned from our anniversary treat, staying here for one night. Dinner (tasting menu), bed and breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good points- wonderful staff, clean, tidy, comfortable, lovely toiletries in the room, great powerful shower, deep full sized bath, beautiful countryside location, incredibly wide range of wines, amazing breakfast.
reviews.title: Stunning in the snow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bad points- no coffee/tea making facilities in the rooms, our bed was two singles attached together- i hate that-there's always that ridge in the bed between you!
reviews.title: Yes!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a lovely treat & trip away, expensive but great quality food, wine and service. As the hotel knew this trip was for our anniversary we got a little cake, as shown in the photo, and a free glass of bubbly to celebrate. Thanks to all of the staff for making it special.
reviews.title: Superb!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second visit to the Lords of the Manor and expectations were high. Whilst the hotel made amends for the issues we experienced, it would have been preferable not to have had to raise them in the first place.The previous review by BatmanMalborough could be word for word my own review as our experience was very similar, so I won't write it all out again.
reviews.title: Seriously good

reviews.text: We had a lovely birthday celebration here. We were well looked after with tea in front of the fire, champagne and a delicious dinner - try the blackcurrant souffle! Our room was very comfortable and quiet. The service was excellent and nothing was too much trouble. It is a small and charming hotel.
reviews.title: Good mid-week stay

reviews.text: We took them up on their special midweek night out offer, cream tea, glass of champagne, market menu dinner and room for the night for £199.00 all in. Not actually that cheap a deal but it’s a nice place and now Michelin starred.
reviews.title: A slightly mixed experience but they came through shining

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It’s a shame but no-one explained the market menu is well down spec and offers no choice and it just wasn’t inspiring. You would at least expect a reasonable table d hote style choice. Something that shows off the kitchen but is using less expensive materials and perhaps a bit simpler time wise to do.
reviews.title: A perfect place to celebrate my birthday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cream tea was just that two mini scones and that’s it. For the price of a scone it’s so silly for this to be so minimal. It shrieks of being just tight.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Champagne before dinner took 25 minutes for two of the glasses to arrive and generally service was very suspect all apart from the sommelier who did a fine job. Just a shame it took an hour to top up my water glass (from a bottle held of table. I am not that lazy) and generally was just not on the ball for this standard of restaurant.
reviews.title: Again a faultless stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is well worthy of its 1 Michelin star. The staff although very friendy, because of their age lacked experience, but that did not deter from a wonder evening. Well thought out wine list, the attraction for me to go back would be the wine list more than the food.
reviews.title: Interesting Wine List

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely overnight stay here on an overnight dinner b&b deal through secret escapes. We had a standard room called the walford room on the ground floor however though clearly not as modern and luxurious as some of the other rooms it was still very comfortable with lovely cosy bed. We upgraded to a different menu on the night simply because there was a choice of foods whereas the set menu had no choices and I couldn't eat some of it however it was well worth paying the extra and we ended up having 8 courses lol!!!! Delicious!!!! and the service from all the staff was brilliant. The breakfast was also excellent. Definitely would recommend this beautiful hotel.
reviews.title: Birthday treat jan 6th 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband I recently booked a Christmas stay at the Manor, and without a doubt this will always be one of our best travel experiences and memories ever. From my early emails to the concierge trying to get "a feel for what the Manor was like and how would we get there" to our send off this was truly a memory maker. We took the train from London and were met by a taxi sent by the Manor. We were then greeted like royalty from the staff in the drive in front of the Manor. We felt like we were in a scene from Downton Abbey .Paul the hotel manager attends to every detail and runs one of the finest hotels in all of The Cotswalds. The Manor is comfortable, not oppulent. Crackling fires, warm staff who are happy to get tea or offer activity suggestions or who leave you alone to enjoy a book in a soft chair are what make this an incredible experience. I love that it feels you can do nothing at all but stare out the beautiful floor to ceiling windows and be doing just the right thing. THe rooms are comfortable and cozy and have everything you need. The bathroom is spacious, modern, and sparkling clean. You feel like you are staying in a large comfortable home. The food is amazing and deserves it's Michelin Star. The wait staff is superb and the sommeliar was extremely knowledgable. You will not find another experience like this tucked away in the Cotwalds. Long quiet walks through countryside that is literally right out of a book. I almost hate to give such a good review, the place will be mobbed. Go enjoy it before that happens!
reviews.title: Magical Experience, Amazing Staff

reviews.text: We squeezed our car through the entrance to the hotel grounds, and, despite the rain, a lady and gentleman came out to welcome us, and to escort us to our rooms. Although it was obvious only a skeleton staff were on duty between Christmas and New Year, some of them trainees, the service was good.
reviews.title: Homely comfort, spoiled by check out surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was large, and cosy, but did it really have to be called "Tracy"? The high bed was very comfortable, there was plenty of wardrobe space, water and juice, and tea, coffee or hot chocolate making facilities were provided, as were magazines, and (a nice touch!) the Radio Times open at the correct day. We should though have appreciated a clock. The bathroom was equally large with a deep free standing bath, double sinks, a shower big enough (but without enough water pressure) for two rain shower heads and a big, heated towel rail. The towels themselves were large and plentiful. My main complaint was the lighting. In both bedroom and bathroom it was so subdued it was impossible to see well enough to make up, and my husband had difficulty reading.
reviews.title: Home from home in the Cotswolds

reviews.text: A fantastic few days with all our family made even better due to the service and quality provided at the Lords of the Manor Hotel.
reviews.title: memories are made here!

reviews.text: The food was a journey of taste at every meal which was also a delight to behold in regards presentation.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay over New Year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing was to much trouble for the staff and it all made for a memorable New Year.
reviews.title: Food, Service, Location etc, all excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a charming hotel which manages to be both cosy and full of character. It's like staying at a house party with friends who come from old money. The staff are efficient and friendly and Paul, the General Manager went out of his way to make sure our stay was exceptional.
reviews.title: Great birthday stay
